acp

Class ACPLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • acp.ACPLogic

  • public class ACPLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This component acts as a controller: receive requests from both the UI and the Plugin, validate the input based on the business rules, and direct them to the appropriate managers for further processing.
    Author:
    Loke Yan Hao

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ACPLogic getInstance()
        Returns the reference to the single instance of ACPLogic.

        This method is a standard method for singleton class

        Returns:
        the reference to the single instance of ACPLogic

      • initialiseLibraries

        public boolean initialiseLibraries()
        Returns true if it is able to initialise all the libraries successfully.

        This method may return false if it is unable to initialise a certain library. If that is the case, the program cannot continue executing. The calling method should prompt an error message and quit the system.

        Returns:
        the result of this operation.

      • processRawText

        public void processRawText(java.lang.String rawText,
                  java.lang.String sourceName)
        Process and store the text extracted from opening windows (source document). The rawText argument is the content of the source document. The sourceName argument is the unique identity to identify the source document.

        This method does not return any result. However if an error occur, GateException is thrown. The caller methods should handle the exception to prompt user about the error.

        Parameters:
        rawText - the content of the source document. For now, it must be HTML document.
        sourceName - the name for the source document.

      • requestSuggestion

        public java.util.List<Suggestion> requestSuggestion(java.lang.String userInput)
        Using prefix search to retrieve a list of suggestions based on the user input. The userInput argument is the text entered by user in a text-editor.

        The result is sorted based on user preference from the PreferenceManager and the user behaviors learned by the machine learning algorithm. This method returns an empty list of suggestions if the actual number of suggestion in the suggestion list exceed the threshold specified in User Preference (Suggestion Threshold).

        Parameters:
        userInput - the text entered by user in a text-editor.
        Returns:
        a list of suggestions with the prefix specified by user input.
        See Also:
        Suggestion

      • chooseSuggestion

        public void chooseSuggestion(java.lang.String sourceName)
        To inform the system that user has selected a specific suggestion for machine learning purposes. The sourceName argument is the selected suggestion's source name.
        Parameters:
        sourceName - the source name of the selected suggestion.

      • requestExtendSuggestion

        public Suggestion requestExtendSuggestion(int id,
                                 int type)
        Retrieve the next paragraph, sentence or word based on the current selected suggestion. The id argument denote which sentence/paragraph it will refer from. The type argument is the type that user wish to request now. Both the previousType and the type can be one of the following type: paragraph, sentence or word.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the sentence/paragraph it will refer from.
        type - the type that user wish to extend now.
        Returns:
        the next suggestion.
        See Also:
        Suggestion

      • closeSourceDocument

        public void closeSourceDocument(java.lang.String sourceName)
        Remove all the text extracted from the specified opening window (source document). The sourceName argument is the name of the source document.
        Parameters:
        sourceName - the name of the source document.

      • changeRanks

        public void changeRanks(java.lang.String sourceName)
        Update the ranking of the opening window (source document). Having a higher source document rank mean that the source document have higher sorting order, and will be listed at the top few entries in the auto-completion suggestion box.

        This method is called by ACPBackground class to give higher ranking for source documents which are recently viewed.

        Parameters:
        sourceName - the source name of the source document.

      • getUserPreference

        public Preference getUserPreference()
        Retrieve the user preference from the configuration file.

        This method always returns a preference object, whether or not the configuration file exists.

        Returns:
        the current user preference options.
        See Also:
        Preference

      • editUserPreference

        public boolean editUserPreference(Preference preference)
        Save the updated user preference to the configuration file. The preference argument contain the updated preference.

        This method will return true if it successfully update the configuration file.

        Parameters:
        preference - the updated user preference options.
        Returns:
        the result of this operation.

      • storeUserBehaviors

        public void storeUserBehaviors()
        Store the learned user behaviors to a file. This method is called before the program exit.
